Save Window Ranges from Sequences of Days

Source: R/save_window_ranges.R
save_window_ranges.Rd

This function processes a list of sequences of days and saves the ranges for each sequence. For each sequence, it identifies the start and end days of the window and compiles these into a data frame.

save_window_ranges(sequences_days)

Arguments

sequences_days

List. A list of sequences of days, where each sequence is a vector of day numbers. Each sequence represents a period of interest.

Value

A data frame with two columns:

window.close

The start day of each sequence.

window.open

The end day of each sequence.

Details

The function performs the following:

  • Checks if there is only one sequence in the list and handles it accordingly.

  • Loops through each sequence of days in the list.

  • For each sequence, it extracts the first and last day to define the range.

  • Converts the results into a data frame for easier handling.

Examples

# Example usage of the save_window_ranges function
sequences <- list(c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5), c(10, 11, 12, 13))
window_ranges <- save_window_ranges(sequences)
#> Error in save_window_ranges(sequences): could not find function "save_window_ranges"
print(window_ranges)
#> Error: object 'window_ranges' not found
